page.title: 17Archaeology ; Papa Westray
page.content: {Stone Age}:The remains of a treb-dyke can still be seen. At the Knap of Howar there are two stone dwelling houses. On the Holm there is a chambered cairn and a stalled cairn. {Bronze Age :}On the North Hill are several small circular burial mounds. The Broch of Bothekan, a circular stone defensive tower, is presently covered with sand. {Iron Age:}The remains of a settlement can be seen in the eroding cliff face at Monkerhoose. {Pictish and Early Christian:}The remains of the chapel of St. Tredwall can still be seen. St. Boniface Church dates from the 12th. century. {Early Norse:}There are several farm mounds and boat nausts as well as the "hog backed" stone found in St. Boniface Churchyard.
